properties.LocationArea: SH 29 Lane closure: No entry to Cambridge Road from SH29
properties.EventComments: Due to an infrastructure upgrade, a 24/7 Northbound lane closure is in place from the SH29 intersection to 579 Cambridge Rd until early February. The Southbound lane remains open. Detours are in place and speed restrictions apply. Some extended shifts (7am to 12am) and night works (6pm to 6am) will occur.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Bethlehem-bound vehicles from SH29 detour via SH29 Takitimu Drive Toll Road (toll applies) or SH29A and Cameron Rd (free route). Kaimai Range/Hamilton-bound vehicles turn left onto SH29 then change direction at the SH29/SH36 roundabout. A 60km/h speed limit is in place on the SH29 approach to the intersection, and 30km/h in the immediate vicinity of the work site.
properties.Name: Road Work: SH 29 Lane closure: No entry to Cambridge Road from SH29

properties.Name: Road Work: SH 80 Pukaki to Mt Cook (Aoraki Mt Cook Highway)

properties.EventComments: Due to the replacement of a large culvert at Taitarakihi Creek in Timaru there will be lane reductions and 30km/h temporary speed restrictions in place 24/7 from 8th September 2025 to 6th March 2026. Expect congestion and delays in the area, allowing extra time for travel.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Access to Grants Rd from SH1 will be closed from Thursday 27th November.  Please use alternative side streets to access the State Highway.
properties.Name: Road Work: SH 1 Timaru

properties.LocationArea: SH 58 Haywards, between Hebden Crescent and Bradey Road intersection
properties.EventComments: Due to works for the SH58 Safety Improvements Project, there are temporary lane shifts and various speed restrictions in place. Plan your journey accordingly, allowing extra time to travel through this area.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 58 Haywards, between Hebden Crescent and Bradey Road intersection

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 Taradale, between the intersections of Meeanee Road and Taradale Road
properties.EventComments: Due to various works, this section of road will be closed in both directions on Sunday to Thursday nights between 8pm and 5am from Sunday 25th January to Friday 27th February. Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for travel.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Detour via Meeanee Road, Lee Road, Gloucester Street and Taradale Road.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 2 Taradale, between the intersections of Meeanee Road and Taradale Road

properties.EventComments: Night Road Closure Due to road rebuilding works on SH1 between Rangipo and Waiouru, 15th Feb to 09 March - Sunday to Thursday nights, 7pm-6am. and speed restrictions will be in place during the day. Expect delays
properties.AlternativeRoute: detour via SH41, SH47, SH4, SH49 and back to SH1
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 01 Rangipo to Waiouru

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 & SH3 Woodville, between Ross Street and Fergusson Street
properties.EventComments: Due to resurfacing works, various sections of this road will be closed in both directions on Sunday to Thursday nights between 6pm and 6am from Sunday 8th February to Monday 16th March. Outside of these hours, SH2 southbound will remain closed.  Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for travel
properties.AlternativeRoute: Follow signposted detours on site depending on the section of road that is closed. Heavy vehicles, detour via Woodlands Road, Oxford Road and Pinfold Road.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 2 & SH3 Woodville, between Ross Street and Fergusson Street

properties.EventComments: Due to road rebuilding works on SH1 between Wairakei and Centennial Dr , Night Stop/Go Sunday-Thursday nights, 7pm-6am. and speed restrictions will be in place during the day and night. Expect delays
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 01 Wairakei to Rotokawa

properties.LocationArea: SH 1 Spring Creek, near the intersection with Ferry Road
properties.EventComments: Due to road reconstruction works, there will be Stop.Go traffic management in place on Mondays to Saturdays between 7am and 6pm from Monday 12th January to Tuesday 31st March. Outside of these hours, there will be a temporary speed restriction in place. Plan your journey accordingly and expect up to 10 minute delays.
properties.Name: Scheduled Road Work: SH 1 Spring Creek, near the intersection with Ferry Road

properties.EventComments: Due to road rebuilding works on SH1 between Aitamuri and Taupo, Night Stop/Go Sunday-Thursday nights, 7pm-6am. and speed restrictions will be in place during the day and night. Expect delays
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 01 Atiamuri to Wairakei

properties.EventComments: Due to bridge maintenance works, this bridge will be closed on Sunday to Thursday nights between 8pm and 6am from Sunday 18th January to Friday 27th January (Excluding Public Holiday weekends). Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for travel if travelling at night.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Detour via Kane Road and Camp Hill Road. Please note this detour will add approximately 30 minutes to your journey time and is not suitable for  HPMV or 50MAX vehicles. HPMV or 50MAX vehicles, detour via Kane Road, Cemetery road, Domain Road and Capell Avenue.
properties.Name: Scheduled Road Work: SH 8A Luggate (Red Bridge)

properties.EventComments: Due to concrete deck pouring works, this bridge will be closed to heavy vehicles and  Stop/Go traffic management will be in place for all other vehicles at all times from 7am on Wednesday 14th January to 6pm on Sunday 18th January and from 7am on Thursday 22nd January to 6pm on Monday 26th January. Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for travel.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Heavy vehicles, detour via SH4, Ohura Road, and Mangaparo Road. All other vehicles should expect 5 minute delays travelling through this site.
properties.Name: Scheduled Road Work: SH 43 Taumarunui (Pongahuru Stream Bridge)

properties.LocationArea: SH 73 West Melton, at the intersection with Jowers Road
properties.EventComments: Due to resurfacing works, there will be Stop/Go traffic management in place on Monday 19th January and Tuesday 20th January nights between 6pm and 6am. Plan your journey accordingly and expect up to 20 minute delays.
properties.Name: Scheduled Road Work: SH 73 West Melton, at the intersection with Jowers Road

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 Domain Road RAB to Paengaroa RAB
properties.EventComments: Due to Bridge Beam Installation ongoing works, SH2 TEL Domain Road RAB to Paengaroa RAB will be closed over 2 nights. Both directions Wednesday 28 and Thursday 29 Jan. 8pm to 5am .. After these hours 70kph temporary speed limit remains in place for lane closures, Follow signed detours.
properties.AlternativeRoute: East and West bound traffic to follow detour via Te Puke Highway
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 2 Domain Road RAB to Paengaroa RAB

properties.EventComments: Due to water works, there will be Stop/Go traffic management with a 30km/h speed restriction in place from Monday 15th September to Tuesday 30th June 2026 between 7am and 5pm. Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for travel.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 88 St Leonards to Roseneath

properties.EventComments: Due to seawall repair works, there will be temporary traffic signals in place from Wednesday 14th January to Wednesday 18th February between 6am and 6pm. Plan your journey accordingly and expect up to 20 minute delays.
properties.Name: Scheduled Road Work: SH 1 1km south of Peketa

properties.EventComments: Due to works, Stop/Go traffic management and speed restrictions will be in place between 6am  6pm. Take extra care and allow for delays.
properties.Name: Road Work: SH 25 Waihi - Whiritoa

properties.EventComments: Due to an underslip, a lane closure is in place with stop-go temporary traffic management between Stanley Road and Fraser Road. The lane closure will remain until permanent repairs are completed. Please drive with care and expect minor delays.
properties.Name: Road Hazard: SH 2 Taneatua

properties.EventComments: Due to road reconstruction and surfacing works, there will be temporary traffic signals in place on Mondays to Fridays between 7am and 6pm from Monday 17th November to approximately the end of March. Plan your journey accordingly and expect up to 10 minute delays. Please note these works will cease over the holiday period.
properties.Name: Road Work: SH 90 Waikaka Valley to Willowbank

properties.EventComments: Due to slips on SH31 between Raglan Road and the Mangaora Inlet, priority give way's are in place 24/7 until further notice. Please take care when passing through the slip sites.
properties.Name: Road Hazard: SH 31 Kawhia

properties.LocationArea: SH 29 Belk Road to Takitimu Drive
properties.EventComments:
Due to Road Construction and Tauriko enabling works there will be continuous lane diversions, shoulder closures and Stop/Go operations throughout the period of works. Sunday 8pm to Friday 5pm.
Please drive with care as 30kph, 50kph,60kph and 70kph temporary speed limits will be in place at all times.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 29 Belk Road to Takitimu Drive

properties.EventComments: Due to watermain renewal works, there will be a Stop/Go or temporary traffic signals in place 24/7 from Monday 15th September for approximately 12 months (Excluding public holidays). Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for travel.
properties.Name: Road Work: SH 88 Roseneath to St Leonards

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 Turner Rd to Apata Station Rd, Whakamarama
properties.EventComments: Road widening works are underway in preparation for the new roundabout. Lane shifts are in place along with 30km/h speed restrictions. There will be stop/go traffic management in place 15 May to 1 June 2026 work stages required ,  9am-4pm daily, which may cause longer delays. after these hours there will be 30km/h temporary speed for loose chip and uneven surface  Allow extra time.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 2 Turner Rd to Apata Station Rd, Whakamarama

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 Francis Road to Youngson Road
properties.EventComments:
From Friday 7 March there will be a roundabout in place at the intersection of State Highway 2 and Omokoroa Road. 
Overnight on Thursday, 6 March, a temporary roundabout will be marked out, which will remain in place until Western Bay of Plenty District Councils State Highway 2 Omokoroa Road intersection upgrade has been completed.
The temporary roundabout will be a smaller and simpler version the final road layout.
Work will then continue on the lanes north of the new roundabout. expect delays
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 2 Francis Road to Youngson Road

properties.Name: News: South Island Regional and District Council Websites

properties.Content:
FINAL UPDATE THU 17 OCT 2019

Kuaotunu River bridge reopens

Our contractors have done a fantastic job to get the bridge opened ahead of schedule, and more than a week before Labour weekend, despite the heavy rain and strong winds that battered the area earlier this week. Traffic management remains in place, including a 30km/h speed restriction.

Please note that, weather dependent, the bridge will need to close again for the day on Monday (21 Oct) to carry out resurfacing works.

---------------

 

UPDATE TUE 08 OCT 2019

Repairing Kuaotunu bridge to reconnect SH25 

Work to repair the Kuaotunu Bridge on SH25 Coromandel after last months storm is progressing well, with the bridge expected to reopen within the next couple of weeks.

The repair team has finished driving the piles on the northern side of the bridge and has switched to the southern side. Once all the piles have been driven they will need to be cut to size and the bridge abutments filled with concrete before work to reinstate the bridge deck can begin.

We understand that these works are frustrating for local residents and those who travel to the area often, however, our contractors are working as hard as they can to repair the damage as quickly and efficiently as possible, says Transport Agency Waikato Systems Manager Karen Boyt.  

The Transport Agency has joined together with Thames Coromandel District Council to provide a free shuttle bus service from Kuaotunu to Whitianga every day while the bridge is closed.

The Go Kiwi shuttle departs from outside the Kuaotunu fire station, at 7:30am and 8:30am and then returns from Whitianga at 4:30pm and 5:30pm. From Wednesday 9 October there will also be a lunchtime bus leaving Whitianga at 11.30 and Kuaotunu at 12pm. 

Anyone travelling in the area should check our Journey Planner, www.journeys.nzta.govt.nz or call 0800 44 44 49 before leaving for the most up to date information. 

[image src="/assets/8e66b60fd1/NZTA-3.jpg" id="1023" width="657" height="507" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="NZTA 3"]

[image src="/assets/5b38db22be/nzta-2.jpg" id="1022" width="657" height="586" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="nzta 2"]

 

 ---------------

Following an assessment after recent heavy rain, the SH25 Kuaotunu River bridge has been closed, for around five weeks, to repair weather damage.

We understand the frustration this may cause for those who live in or travel to the area often, however our contractors are working as hard as they can to repair the damage as quickly and efficiently as possible.

During this time detours will be clearly signposted via either SH25A and SH25 or SH25 Thames Coast Road.

 [image src="/assets/dd1a4446a4/Kuaotunu-IMG_STOP.jpg" id="1019" width="251" height="303" class="ss-htmleditorfield-file image right" title="Kuaotunu IMG STOP"]
  • Residents south of Blackjack Road will need to access Kuaotunu from Whitianga.
  • Residents west of the bridge will only have vehicle access from the Coromandel side.
  • Pedestrians will be able to cross the river via a separate, existing walk bridge. 

We hope to have the bridge open again by Labour Weekend, however, this is weather dependant. We will keep the community updated, and thank you for your patience during this time.

 

UPDATE TUE 24 SEP 2019

Repair works to SH25 Kuaotonu River Bridge began on Sunday 22 Sep, following an early morning karakia by local Iwi. Our contractors have started to remove the wooden deck after stripping back the seal layers. The seal and deck have been removed by hand, and efforts made to protect the environment by installing a platform below the deck.

[image src="/assets/b241894b48/Kuaotunu-IMG_6039.jpg" id="1018" width="733" height="550" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="Kuaotunu IMG 6039"]
properties.Name: Road Work: Kuaotunu River Bridge Repairs
